name: Boogeyman
description: Even a century after first contact with them, for many, the Gorn are still largely unfamiliar. Rumors swell about their ferocity. When a Federation ship stumbles into their territory, their legendary brutality becomes frightening reality.
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Number One, Ortegas, Uhura, Gorn crew, Brutal crew, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the Pike's Enterprise, the Gorn Raider, or the Galaxy-Class Ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Number One, Ortegas, Uhura, Gorn, or Brutal

featured_crew.name: Vedala
featured_crew.flavor: She gathered the expedition to retrieve the stolen Soul of Alar and prevent the Skorr from starting a holy war.

featured_crew.name: Ortegas
featured_crew.flavor: Helmsman of the U.S.S Enterprise under Captain Pikeâ€™s command, she brags about being the best pilot to graduate the academy.

featured_crew.name: Uhura
featured_crew.flavor: Commander Uhura served under Captain Spock during the attempted theft of the Genesis Device.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Gorn Raider
ship.flavor: Gorn Raider ships were used to attack an Earth Outpost on Cestus III. There attack was devestating and resulted in almost all the Outpost's crew and family.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Vedala
rewards.flavor: She gathered the expedition to retrieve the stolen Soul of Alar and prevent the Skorr from starting a holy war.

rewards.name: Uhura
rewards.flavor: Commander Uhura served under Captain Spock during the attempted theft of the Genesis Device.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "What better way to say 'welcome to the 24th century' than by sticking us on a Gorn mission, huh? It looks like a Federation ship stumbled upon a territory protected by a horde of Gorn ships and now they've set their sights on any and all nearby Federation targets."
"Ugh, Gorn. I get that you all supposedly have a better relationship with them in this time period, but I'm not seeing it. Do you even know how they--"

"THANK YOU, Lieutenant Commander. We don't know if the Captain here is just coming off of lunch or not, so maybe we should save that detail. Anyway, if relations really have improved, there must be an explanation for this. Captain, we're counting on you to rise to the challenge."

"What better way to say 'welcome to the 24th century' than by sticking us on a Gorn mission, huh? It looks like a Federation ship stumbled upon a territory protected by a horde of Gorn ships and now they've set their sights on any and all nearby Federation targets."
"Ugh, Gorn. I get that you all supposedly have a better relationship with them in this time period, but I'm not seeing it. Do you even know how they--"

"THANK YOU, Lieutenant Commander. We don't know if the Captain here is just coming off of lunch or not, so maybe we should save that detail. Anyway, if relations really have improved, there must be an explanation for this. Captain, we're counting on you to rise to the challenge."

"Thanks to you, Captain, we received a response. Unfortunately, it's not the invitation to diplomacy we hoped for. The Gorn are accusing the Federation ship of trespassing on space reserved for their nurseries. They see it as an act of aggression, so they're responding in kind."

"Strange. There's no data suggesting that area is Gorn space, nor is there anything on Gorn nurseries in the modern era. I suppose it's naive to hope they've found other, less lethal methods of reproducing, isn't it?"

responses.text: "I'd rather not go to war with the Gorn..."
"There has to be more to the story..."

screens.text: "Ugh. If these nurseries are using humans and other species for breeding, I'm already out of sympathy for them. What do you think, Captain? What do we do?"
"Agreed. I believe we can get through to them, but considering our past experiences with the Gorn, they rarely respond well when they sense weakness."
"I agree. The Gorn Hegemony may not be the most temperate entity we've encountered, but this sudden hostility suggests something bigger's going on here."
"Right! We'll bring it to them! One of our ships stumbles into their space and they send an entire fleet? We can't just take this lying down."
"It looks like we're out of time for discussion. The Gorn ships are gearing up for another attack. We're following your lead, Captain."

"Thanks to you, Captain, we received a response. Unfortunately, it's not the invitation to diplomacy we hoped for. The Gorn are accusing the Federation ship of trespassing on space reserved for their nurseries. They see it as an act of aggression, so they're responding in kind."

"Strange. There's no data suggesting that area is Gorn space, nor is there anything on Gorn nurseries in the modern era. I suppose it's naive to hope they've found other, less lethal methods of reproducing, isn't it?"

responses.text: "I'd rather not go to war with the Gorn..."
"There has to be more to the story..."

screens.text: "Ugh. If these nurseries are using humans and other species for breeding, I'm already out of sympathy for them. What do you think, Captain? What do we do?"
"Agreed. I believe we can get through to them, but considering our past experiences with the Gorn, they rarely respond well when they sense weakness."
"I agree. The Gorn Hegemony may not be the most temperate entity we've encountered, but this sudden hostility suggests something bigger's going on here."
"Right! We'll bring it to them! One of our ships stumbles into their space and they send an entire fleet? We can't just take this lying down."
"It looks like we're out of time for discussion. The Gorn ships are gearing up for another attack. We're following your lead, Captain."
